title: Authors and Citation
text: Jingmeng Cui. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Cui J (2023). fitlandr: Fit Vector Fields Potential Landscapes Intensive Longitudinal Data. https://sciurus365.github.io/fitlandr/, https://github.com/Sciurus365/fitlandr.
code: @Manual{,   title = {fitlandr: Fit Vector Fields and Potential Landscapes from Intensive Longitudinal Data},   author = {Jingmeng Cui},   year = {2023},   note = {https://sciurus365.github.io/fitlandr/, https://github.com/Sciurus365/fitlandr}, }

what:
Fit Vector Fields and Potential Landscapes from Intensive
    Longitudinal Data
title:
Fit Vector Fields and Potential Landscapes from Intensive
    Longitudinal Data
text: toolbox estimating vector fields intensive longitudinal data, construct potential landscapes thereafter. vector fields can estimated two nonparametric methods: Multivariate Vector Field Kernel Estimator (MVKE) Bandi & Moloche (2018) https://doi.org/10.1017/S0266466617000305 Sparse Vector Field Consensus (SparseVFC) algorithm Ma et al. (2013) https://doi.org/10.1016/j.patcog.2013.05.017. potential landscapes can constructed simulation-based approach simlandr package (Cui et al., 2021) https://doi.org/10.31234/osf.io/pzva3, Bhattacharya et al. (2011) method path integration https://doi.org/10.1186/1752-0509-5-85.

title:
Fit Vector Fields and Potential Landscapes from Intensive
    Longitudinal Data
text: can install development version fitlandr GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("Sciurus365/fitlandr")

title:
Fit Vector Fields and Potential Landscapes from Intensive
    Longitudinal Data
text: use following bistable dynamic system illustrate use fitlandr. test data set created follows.  Fit vector field MVKE (see ?MVKE explanations parameters):  Fit potential landscape:
code: single_output_grad <- simlandr::sim_fun_grad(length = 200, seed = 1614)  library(tidyverse) ggplot(data = single_output_grad %>% as_tibble()) +     geom_path(aes(x = 1:200, y = x), color = "blue") +     geom_path(aes(x = 1:200, y = y), color = "red") +     theme_bw() library(fitlandr) v2 <- fit_2d_vf(single_output_grad, x = "x", y = "y", method = "MVKE") plot(v2) future::plan("multisession") set.seed(1614) l2 <- fit_3d_vfld(v2, .sim_vf_options = sim_vf_options(chains = 16, stepsize = 1, forbid_overflow = TRUE), .simlandr_options = simlandr_options(adjust = 5, Umax = 4)) #> ℹ Simulating the model✔ Simulating the model [26.7s] #> ℹ Constructing the landscape✔ Constructing the landscape [3.1s] plot(l2, 2) # equivalent: # s2 <- sim_vf(v2, chains = 16, stepsize = 1, forbid_overflow = TRUE) # l2 <- simlandr::make_3d_static(s2, x = "x", y = "y", lims = v2$lims, adjust = 5, Umax = 4)

what: Add a grid to a vectorfield object to enable linear interpolation — add_interp_grid
title: Add a grid to a vectorfield object to enable linear interpolation — add_interp_grid
text: Add grid vectorfield object enable linear interpolation

title: Add a grid to a vectorfield object to enable linear interpolation — add_interp_grid
code: add_interp_grid(vf, lims = vf$lims, n = vf$n)

title: Add a grid to a vectorfield object to enable linear interpolation — add_interp_grid
text: vf vectorfield object estimated fit_2d_vf(). lims limits range vector field estimation c(<xl>, <xu>, <yl>, <yu>). missing, range data extended 10% sides used. n number equally spaced points axis, vectors estimated.

title: Add a grid to a vectorfield object to enable linear interpolation — add_interp_grid
text: vectorfield project interp_grid field.

title: Align potential values — align_pot_B
text: path-potentials end global min generate potential surface interpolation grid.

title: Align potential values — align_pot_B
code: align_pot_B(resultB, n = 200, digits = 2, linear = TRUE, ...)

title: Align potential values — align_pot_B
text: resultB Result path_integral_B(). n number equally spaced points axis, landscape estimated. digits Currently, raw sample points regions dense may crashes interpolation. avoid problem, one point  first several digits. kept. Use parameter indicate many digits considered. Note temporary solution might changed near future. linear logical – indicating whether linear spline interpolation used. ... parameters passed akima::interp()

title: Align potential values — align_pot_B
text: list 3 components: x,y vectors x- y- coordinates output grid, input     argument xo, yo, present.  Otherwise,     default, vector 40 points evenly spaced range     input x. z matrix fitted z-values.  value z[,j] computed     x,y point xo[], yo[j]. z     dimensions length(xo) times length(yo). input SpatialPointsDataFrame  SpatialPixelssDataFrame returned.

what: A fast bilinear interpolation function — fast_bilinear
title: A fast bilinear interpolation function — fast_bilinear
text: assumes equal grid intervals, thus can find correct position \(O(1)\) time.

title: A fast bilinear interpolation function — fast_bilinear
code: fast_bilinear(x, y, z, x0, y0)

title: A fast bilinear interpolation function — fast_bilinear
text: x vector containing x coordinates rectangular data grid. y vector containing y coordinates rectangular data grid. z matrix containing z[,j] data values grid points (x[],y[j]). x0 x value used interpolate . y0 y value used interpolate .

title: A fast bilinear interpolation function — fast_bilinear
text: list contains one element, z.

title: A fast bilinear interpolation function — fast_bilinear
text: following documentation akima::bilinear(). implementation bilinear interpolating function. point (x0,y0) contained rectangle (x1,y1),(x2,y1), (x2,y2),(x1,y2) x1<x2, y1<y2, first step get z() locations (x0,y1) (x0,y2) convex linear combinations z(x0,y*)=az(x1,y)+(1-)z(x2,y) =(x2-x1)/(x0-x1) y*=y1,y2. second step z(x0,y0) calculated convex linear combination z(x0,y1) z(x0,y2) z(x0,y1)=b*z(x0,y1)+(1-b)*z(x0,y2) b=(y2-y1)/(y0-y1). Finally, z(x0,y0) convex linear combination z values corners containing rectangle weights according distance (x0,y0) corners.

what: Find equilibrium points for a vector field — find_eqs
title: Find equilibrium points for a vector field — find_eqs
text: Find equilibrium points vector field

title: Find equilibrium points for a vector field — find_eqs
code: find_eqs(vf, starts, jacobian_params = list(), ...)

title: Find equilibrium points for a vector field — find_eqs
text: vf vectorfield object estimated fit_2d_vf(). starts vector indicating starting value solving equilibrium point, list vectors providing multiple starting values together. jacobian_params Parameters passed numDeriv::jacobian(). ... Parameters passed rootSolve::multiroot().

title: Find equilibrium points for a vector field — find_eqs
text: list equilibrium points details. Use print.vectorfield_eqs() inspect .

title: Estimate a 2D vector field — fit_2d_vf
text: Estimate 2D vector field intensive longitudinal data. Two methods can used: Multivariate Vector Field Kernel Estimator (MVKE, using MVKE()), Sparse Vector Field Consensus (SparseVFC, using SparseVFC::SparseVFC()). Note input data automatically normalized sent estimation engines make sure default parameter settings close optimal. Therefore, need scale parameters MVKE() SparseVFC::SparseVFC(). suggest MVKE method used psychological data realistic assumptions produces reasonable output.

title: Estimate a 2D vector field — fit_2d_vf
code: fit_2d_vf(   data,   x,   y,   lims,   n = 20,   vector_position = "start",   na_action = "omit_data_points",   method = c("MVKE", "MVKE"),   ... )

title: Estimate a 2D vector field — fit_2d_vf
text: data data set used estimating vector field. data frame matrix. x, y Characters indicate name two variables. lims limits range vector field estimation c(<xl>, <xu>, <yl>, <yu>). missing, range data extended 10% sides used. n number equally spaced points axis, vectors estimated. vector_position useful method == "VFC". One "start", "middle", "end", representing position vectors. "start", example, starting point vector regarded position vector. na_action One "omit_data_points" "omit_vectors". using "omit_data_points", NA points omitted, points NA form vector. using "omit_vectors", vectors omitted either points NA. method One "MVKE" "VFC". ... parameters passed MVKE() SparseVFC::SparseVFC().

title: Estimate a 2D vector field — fit_2d_vf
text: vectorfield object.

title: Estimate a 2D vector field — fit_2d_vf
code: # generate data single_output_grad <- simlandr::sim_fun_grad(length = 200, seed = 1614) # fit the vector field v2 <- fit_2d_vf(single_output_grad, x = "x", y = "y", method = "MVKE") plot(v2)

what: Estimate a 3D potential landscape from a vector field — fit_3d_vfld
title: Estimate a 3D potential landscape from a vector field — fit_3d_vfld
text: Two methods available: method = "pathB" method = "simlandr". See Details section.

title: Estimate a 3D potential landscape from a vector field — fit_3d_vfld
code: fit_3d_vfld(   vf,   method = c("simlandr", "pathB"),   .pathB_options = pathB_options(vf),   .sim_vf_options = sim_vf_options(vf),   .simlandr_options = simlandr_options(vf),   linear_interp = FALSE )

title: Estimate a 3D potential landscape from a vector field — fit_3d_vfld
text: vf vectorfield object estimated fit_2d_vf(). method method used landscape construction. Can pathB simlandr. .pathB_options method = "pathB". Options controlling path-integral algorithm. generated sim_vf_options(). .sim_vf_options method = "simlandr". Options controlling vector field simulation. generated sim_vf_options(). .simlandr_options method = "simlandr". Options controlling landscape construction. generated simlandr_options(). linear_interp Use linear interpolation method estimate drift vector (diffusion matrix). can speed calculation. TRUE, sure linear grid calculated vector field using <vf> <- add_interp_grid(<vf>).

title: Estimate a 3D potential landscape from a vector field — fit_3d_vfld
text: landscape object described simlandr::make_3d_static(), 3d_static_landscape_B object, inherits landscape class contains following elements: dist, distribution estimation landscapes; plot, 3D plot using plotly; plot_2, 2D plot using ggplot2; x, y, vf.

title: Estimate a 3D potential landscape from a vector field — fit_3d_vfld
text: method = "simlandr", landscape constructed based generalized potential landscape Wang et al. (2008), implemented simlandr package. function wrapper sim_vf() simlandr::make_3d_static(). Use two functions separately customization. method = "pathB", landscape constructed based deterministic path-integral quasi-potential defined Bhattacharya et al. (2011). recommend simlandr method psychological data stable. Parallel computing based future supported methods. Use future::plan("multisession") enable speed computation.

title: Estimate a 3D potential landscape from a vector field — fit_3d_vfld
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() # generate data single_output_grad <- simlandr::sim_fun_grad(length = 200, seed = 1614) # fit the vector field v2 <- fit_2d_vf(single_output_grad, x = "x", y = "y", method = "MVKE") plot(v2) # fit the landscape future::plan("multisession") set.seed(1614) l2 <- fit_3d_vfld(v2, .sim_vf_options = sim_vf_options(chains = 16, stepsize = 1, forbid_overflow = TRUE), .simlandr_options = simlandr_options(adjust = 5, Umax = 4)) plot(l2, 2) future::plan("sequential") }

what: fitlandr: Fit Vector Fields and Potential Landscapes from Intensive Longitudinal Data — fitlandr-package
title: fitlandr: Fit Vector Fields and Potential Landscapes from Intensive Longitudinal Data — fitlandr-package
text: toolbox estimating vector fields intensive longitudinal data, construct potential landscapes thereafter. vector fields can estimated two nonparametric methods: Multivariate Vector Field Kernel Estimator (MVKE) Bandi & Moloche (2018) doi:10.1017/S0266466617000305  Sparse Vector Field Consensus (SparseVFC) algorithm Ma et al. (2013) doi:10.1016/j.patcog.2013.05.017 . potential landscapes can constructed simulation-based approach 'simlandr' package (Cui et al., 2021) doi:10.31234/osf.io/pzva3 , Bhattacharya et al. (2011) method path integration doi:10.1186/1752-0509-5-85 .

title: fitlandr: Fit Vector Fields and Potential Landscapes from Intensive Longitudinal Data — fitlandr-package
text: Maintainer: Jingmeng Cui jingmeng.cui@outlook.com (ORCID)

what: Multivariate vector field kernel estimator — MVKE
title: Multivariate vector field kernel estimator — MVKE
text: See references details.

title: Multivariate vector field kernel estimator — MVKE
code: MVKE(d, h = 0.2, kernel = c("exp", "Gaussian"))

title: Multivariate vector field kernel estimator — MVKE
text: d dataset. matrix data frame, row representing random vector. h bandwidth kernel estimator. kernel type kernel estimator used. "exp" default (exp()), "Gaussian" stats::dnorm() used.

title: Multivariate vector field kernel estimator — MVKE
text: function(x), returns \(\mu\) \(\) estimators position \(x\).

title: Multivariate vector field kernel estimator — MVKE
text: Bandi, F. M., & Moloche, G. (2018). functional estimation multivariate diffusion processes. Econometric Theory, 34(4), 896-946. https://doi.org/10.1017/S0266466617000305

text: See path_integral_B(), align_pot_B() details.

title: Options controlling the path-integral algorithm — pathB_options
code: pathB_options(   vf,   lims = rlang::expr(vf$lims),   n_path_int = 20,   stepsize = 0.01,   tol = 0.01,   numTimeSteps = 1400,   n = 200,   digits = 2,   linear = TRUE,   ... )

title: Options controlling the path-integral algorithm — pathB_options
text: vf vectorfield object estimated fit_2d_vf(). lims limits range estimation c(<xl>, <xu>, <yl>, <yu>). n_path_int number equally spaced points axis, path integrals calculated. stepsize stepsize Euler–Maruyama simulation system. tol tolerance test convergence. numTimeSteps Number time steps integrating along path (ensure uniform arrays). Choose high-enough number convergence given stepsize. n number equally spaced points axis, landscape estimated. digits Currently, raw sample points regions dense may crashes interpolation. avoid problem, one point  first several digits. kept. Use parameter indicate many digits considered. Note temporary solution might changed near future. linear logical – indicating whether linear spline interpolation used. ... use.

title: Options controlling the path-integral algorithm — pathB_options
text: list containing parameters corresponding function. intended used within fit_3d_vfld()

what: Bhattacharya method for path integration — path_integral_B
title: Bhattacharya method for path integration — path_integral_B
text: method construct potential landscapes using path integration. See references details.

title: Bhattacharya method for path integration — path_integral_B
code: path_integral_B(   f,   lims,   n_path_int = 20,   stepsize = 0.01,   tol = 0.01,   numTimeSteps = 1400,   ... )

title: Bhattacharya method for path integration — path_integral_B
text: f vector field function. return c(<dx/dt>, <dy/dt>) lims limits range estimation c(<xl>, <xu>, <yl>, <yu>). n_path_int number equally spaced points axis, path integrals calculated. stepsize time step used iteration. tol tolerance test convergence. numTimeSteps Number time steps integrating along path (ensure uniform arrays). Choose high-enough number convergence given stepsize. ... use.

title: Bhattacharya method for path integration — path_integral_B
text: list following elements: numPaths Integer. Total Number paths defined grid spacing. pot_path Matrix. Potential along paths. path_tag Vector. Tag given paths. attractors_pot Vector. Potential value identified attractor path integral approach. x_path Vector. x-coord. along path. y_path Vector. y-coord. along path.

title: Bhattacharya method for path integration — path_integral_B
text: Bhattacharya, S., Zhang, Q., & Andersen, M. E. (2011). deterministic map Waddington’s epigenetic landscape cell fate specification. BMC Systems Biology, 5(1), 85. https://doi.org/10.1186/1752-0509-5-85. functions file translated Matlab code provided reference , Python translation https://dynamo-release.readthedocs.io/en/v0.95.2/_modules/dynamo/vectorfield/Bhattacharya.html

title: Plot a 2D vector field — plot.vectorfield
text: Plot 2D vector field estimated fit_2d_vf(). Powered ggplot2::ggplot().

title: Plot a 2D vector field — plot.vectorfield
code: # S3 method for vectorfield plot(   x,   arrow = grid::arrow(length = grid::unit(0.1, "cm")),   show_estimated_vector = TRUE,   estimated_vector_enlarge = 1,   estimated_vector_options = list(),   show_point = TRUE,   point_options = list(size = 0.5),   show_original_vector = FALSE,   original_vector_enlarge = 1,   original_vector_options = list(),   show_used_vector = FALSE,   used_vector_options = list(color = "red"),   show_v_norm = FALSE,   v_norm_options = list(),   ... )

title: Plot a 2D vector field — plot.vectorfield
text: x vectorfield object estimated fit_2d_vf(). arrow description arrow heads vectors plot (representing vector field). Generated grid::arrow(). Also see arrow parameter ggplot2::geom_segment(). show_estimated_vector Show vectors estimated model? TRUE default. estimated_vector_enlarge number. many times vectors (representing estimated vector field) enlarged plot? can useful estimated vector field strong weak. estimated_vector_options list passing customized parameters ggplot2::geom_segment() control vectors representing estimated vector field. show_point Show original data points? TRUE default. point_options list passing customized parameters ggplot2::geom_point() control points representing original data point. show_original_vector Show original vectors (.e., vectors data points)? FALSE default. original_vector_enlarge number. many times original vectors enlarged plot? original_vector_options list passing customized parameters ggplot2::geom_segment() control vectors representing original data. show_used_vector vector fields estimated "VFC" method. vectors original data considered inliers specially marked? FALSE default. used_vector_options vector fields estimated "VFC" method. list passing customized parameters ggplot2::geom_segment() control vectors representing inliers. Red default. show_v_norm Show norm estimated vectors (strength vector field)? FALSE default. v_norm_options list passing customized parameters ggplot2::geom_raster() control layer representing norm estimated vectors. ... use.

title: Plot a 2D vector field — plot.vectorfield
text: ggplot2 plot.

TRUE, sure linear grid calculated vector field using <vf> <- add_interp_grid(<vf>). calculate_a Effective linear_interp == TRUE. want calculate diffusion matrix? Use FALSE can save time. ... use.

text: list v, drift part used vector fields, (calculate_a == TRUE), diffusion part given position.

title: Simulation from vector fields — sim_vf
text: Parallel computing based future supported. Use future::plan("multisession") enable .

title: Simulation from vector fields — sim_vf
code: sim_vf(   vf,   noise = 1,   noise_warmup = noise,   chains = 10,   length = 10000,   discard = 0.3,   stepsize = 0.01,   sparse = 1,   forbid_overflow = FALSE,   linear_interp = FALSE,   inits = matrix(c(stats::runif(chains, min = vf$lims[1], max = vf$lims[2]),     stats::runif(chains, min = vf$lims[3], max = vf$lims[4])), ncol = 2) )

title: Simulation from vector fields — sim_vf
text: vf vectorfield object estimated fit_2d_vf(). noise Relative noise simulation. Set smaller simulation unstable (e.g., elements diffusion matrix finite), set larger simulation converges slowly. noise_warmup noise used warming-period. chains many chains simulations performed? length simulation length chain. discard much starting part chain discarded? (Warming-period.) stepsize stepsize Euler–Maruyama simulation system. sparse number. much want sparse output? noise small, sparse output may make density estimation efficient. forbid_overflow TRUE, simulated system runs margins specified vf, system moved back previous value. can help stabilize simulation. FALSE default. linear_interp Use linear interpolation method estimate drift vector (diffusion matrix). can speed calculation. TRUE, sure linear grid calculated vector field using <vf> <- add_interp_grid(<vf>). inits initial values chain.

title: Simulation from vector fields — sim_vf
text: matrix simulated data.

what: Options controlling the vector field simulation — sim_vf_options
title: Options controlling the vector field simulation — sim_vf_options
text: See sim_vf() details.

title: Options controlling the vector field simulation — sim_vf_options
code: sim_vf_options(   vf,   noise = 1,   noise_warmup = noise,   chains = 10,   length = 10000,   discard = 0.3,   stepsize = 0.01,   sparse = 1,   forbid_overflow = FALSE,   inits = rlang::expr(matrix(c(stats::runif(chains, min = vf$lims[1], max = vf$lims[2]),     stats::runif(chains, min = vf$lims[3], max = vf$lims[4])), ncol = 2)) )

title: Options controlling the vector field simulation — sim_vf_options
text: vf vectorfield object estimated fit_2d_vf(). noise Relative noise simulation. Set smaller simulation unstable (e.g., elements diffusion matrix finite), set larger simulation converges slowly. noise_warmup noise used warming-period. chains many chains simulations performed? length simulation length chain. discard much starting part chain discarded? (Warming-period.) stepsize stepsize Euler–Maruyama simulation system. sparse number. much want sparse output? noise small, sparse output may make density estimation efficient. forbid_overflow TRUE, simulated system runs margins specified vf, system moved back previous value. can help stabilize simulation. FALSE default. inits initial values chain.

title: Options controlling the vector field simulation — sim_vf_options
text: list containing parameters corresponding function. intended used within fit_3d_vfld()

what: Options controlling the landscape construction — simlandr_options
title: Options controlling the landscape construction — simlandr_options
text: control behavior simlandr::make_3d_static(), default values accommodated fitlandr. See simlandr::make_3d_static() details.

title: Options controlling the landscape construction — simlandr_options
code: simlandr_options(   vf,   x = rlang::expr(vf$x),   y = rlang::expr(vf$y),   lims = rlang::expr(vf$lims),   kde_fun = c("ks", "MASS"),   n = 200,   adjust = 1,   h,   Umax = 5 )

title: Options controlling the landscape construction — simlandr_options
text: vf vectorfield object estimated fit_2d_vf(). x, y names target variables. lims limits range density estimator c(xl, xu) 2D landscapes, c(xl, xu, yl, yu) 3D landscapes, c(xl, xu, yl, yu, zl, zu) 4D landscapes. missing, range data extended 10% sides used. landscapes based multiple simulations, largest range simulations (means lowest lower limit highest upper limit) used default. kde_fun kernel estimator use? Choices: "ks" ks::kde() (default; faster using less memory); "base" base::density() (2D landscapes); "MASS" MASS::kde2d() (3D landscapes). n number equally spaced points axis, density estimated. adjust multiplier bandwidth. bandwidth used actually adjust * h. makes easy specify values like "half default" bandwidth. h number, possibly vector 3D 4D landscapes, specifying smoothing bandwidth used. missing, default value kernel estimator used (bw = "SJ" base::density()). Note definition bandwidth might different different kernel estimators. landscapes based multiple simulations, largest h simulations used default. Umax maximum displayed value potential.

title: Options controlling the landscape construction — simlandr_options
text: list containing parameters corresponding function. intended used within fit_3d_vfld()
